body_content.explanation: the strength of magnetic field (= an area around something magnetic) that is required to reduce the magnetization of a magnetized material to zero after it has been made as magnetic as possible :
examples: Once the coating is applied, it is checked for thickness, durability, and coercivity.
Making a core from thin iron sheets, interleaved with an insulating material, brings the coercivity of the core down without harming its useful properties.
